runs.comm: pitched up from over the wicket, swing for the left-armer but that merely takes it down the leg side as Amla flicks at it, touch of pad and it runs fine for four byes
length on the pads this time and Amla whips it through backward square leg, the man on the fence won't get round to it
wicket to wicket and Amla works this to the man at deep square leg for a single
angled across, full and inviting the drive, Stokes sprawls to stop it in the covers
full length on off, punched into the ground back to mid-off
middle and leg, de Villiers clips it firmly in front of deep square leg for a couple more
length ball on off stump, Amla cautiously prods at it in defence
sliding across, short of a length, dabbed toward to backward point
back of a length and tucked off the hips for a couple behind square
full length, fired across quite wide but inside the guidelines and Amla leaves it alone
length on the stumps, Amla tries to go down town but gets an inside edge to the leg side
stays back, nudged through square leg for one more
pitched up and dug out back towards the bowler
full around off stump, Amla punches into the off side, finds the gap for one
length ball on the stumps, 134kph and driven on the up to mid-on
bit of width and de Villiers carves it up and away over backward point, takes a terrific bit of work from Topley running round from third man to prevent four, sliding in front of the rope
shortens his length, nudged through square on the leg side
slightly full and straight and clobbered over midwicket, Stretch Armstrong would have liked that wrist action #rubbery
touch short and whipped through the leg side
dragged down, Amla goes to pull but picks out midwicket
short again, slower ball, I think, swatted down through square leg for one
slanted across the right-handed AB from over the wicket, drops back and guides one to third man
back of a length outside off and Hash slashes at it, takes a healthy edge... and Buttler grasses it moving to his right! The ball runs away for four to further grind Topley's gears
good length, bit of movement off the deck and Amla skies the ball down to third man, leading edge but it won't carry and he'll cruise on, much to Topley's annoyance
back of a length, de Villiers shuffles into line on off stump

banged in short, de Villiers top-edges a pull - right into the bread basket of fine leg! Did that beat him for pace? Seemed to skid on as he swiped across the line, big celebration from Jordan, he's sent AB to Z
on the body, worked behind square on the leg side
big lbw appeal, nipping back in but possibly high... the umpire wasn't interested in that but he has signalled the batsmen were one short there, du Plessis not running his bat in
drops back outside off and runs a single to third man
short ball, drops back and cracks a pull square
length on the stumps, Amla mistimes a scooped drive short of mid-on
full outside off, Amla reaches out and slaps a drive to cover on the bounce

big leading edge... and Willey dives to snaffle it running in from mid-on! This one stopped on Amla as he tried to play across the line. They are going to check the catch with the third umpire but looks like Willey got both sets of fingers under the ball as he slid forward on his knees. Excellent catch and the game is well and truly afoot!
good length outside off, waits for it and runs the ball to backward point
beats the bat, think Stokes ran his fingers over this and it bounces a little more as du Plessis felt for it outside off
pitched up and squirted out towards point
angled across from over the wicket, drops back and dabs through gully
too full from Jordan and it is dispatched first class wide of mid-off, lovely flowing drive from Faf for his first boundary
slightly short, drops back and slaps the ball hard through point
back of a length, slightly wide, Duminy is up on his toes to cut
length ball, 143kph outside off, comes forward and punches on the up to the cover sweeper
pitched up and rapping the pads, bit of inswing beats the inside edge... not given! Struck him on the back pad but probably pitched just outside leg stump
touch straight and worked off the legs for one
pushed across the batsman, who drops back and dabs a single to third man
short ball, swirling down the leg side
pitched up in the channel, opens the face and crunches a drive to backward point
touch back of a length, 140kph outside off, jabbed down in front of cover point for one

slugged up into the night sky, Duminy advancing down the pitch and getting under it... Willey runs back from mid-on but drops an incredibly difficult one-handed chance coming over his shoulder! Did extremely well just to get there, in fairness
low full toss, thumps the pads and Stokes likes it... but again outside the line of leg
dragged down a little short and Duminy hammers a pull in front of the man at deep midwicket
pushed through flat, Duminy tucks one more to leg
slightly short again, du Plessis goes down and pulls to leg
legbreak, spinning back, worked off the back foot through midwicket
flat on the stumps, can't get it away

floated up and spinning away as du Plessis drops back and across... he doesn't play at it, expecting a wide to be called, only for umpire Cloete to say he's happy with the delivery as the batsman had moved into line. Well, well
shortish, goes back and steers a drive to point
top-edged, in the air, down towards fine leg... but short of the fielder running in!
on the stumps, du Plessis dabs it down short into the leg side and they pinch one as Stokes chases in his follow through
on the pads, must have just tickled them on the way through to Buttler
fired in full on leg stump, clipped down to fine leg for one
good length on off stump, du Plessis tries a late dab with an open face, inside edges through his legs
pushed through on leg stump and nurdled to midwicket
gives it some air, Duminy reaches out and taps back to the bowler
floated up on the stumps, drilled through mid-on coming forwards
goes back to a bouncy legbreak outside off and steers in front of backward point for one more
tossed up on middle and off, worked wristily back to Rashid's left
flighted, du Plessis drives into the ground back to the bowler
full length on off and Duminy steps out to flay four over mid-off, sweetly struck out the middle and it flies to the fence for a welcome boundary
back of a length, Duminy nudges off his hip
dug in, maybe a slower ball and du Plessis mistimes a pull, bottom-edging through midwicket
short again, drops back and rolls the wrists on a pull to fine leg
rolls his fingers over it, du Plessis paddles toward short fine leg, bounces in front of Rashid but he does well to stop it
banged in and du Plessis heaves into the Cape Town sky, won't carry but it's asking a lot of Willey - again! - and he can't get his hands under it running from square leg towards deep midwicket
full toss on the stumps, Duminy whips a couple through square leg

tossed up and flubbed down the ground, straight to long-on! Duminy falls to England's legspinner, couldn't get enough elevation on the shot and Root took it securely at waist height, hurled the ball into the air in celebration
pushed across the southpaw, who strokes his first ball through the covers for one
tossed up on middle and off, Faf clips a single back down the ground
on the legs and nurdled square playing back
short, slow legbreak outside off and du Plessis mistimes an aggressive swipe, bottom-edges it nowhere
lovely delivery! Spin and bounce, over the top of the stumps as Rossouw tried to punch down the ground
tossed up and Rossouw tries to reverse sweep, can't get it away
gives ti some air, a little wider and Rossouw gets enough on this reverse-paddle to pick up one wide of Buttler
on the stumps and glances through backward square

cut off the back foot, they want a single but the throw is a good one... Rossouw has to dive at the non-striker's end as Moeen relays the ball on to the stumps. His bat was flat as it slid through the crease, so he's fine
flicked off the pads for one more - another decent over for England, tightening things up
slightly short and straight and worked through mid-on
flighted, on the stumps, hit back to the bowler - another dot
clears the ropes, big strike down the ground from Rossouw! Skipped out and creamed a lofted drive back over long-on
pushed through a bit quicker, mishits a slog back towards the bowler
floated up a bit higher on middle and leg, goes for the slog-sweep, fails to connect
driven through the covers coming forwards
drops back and goes for the reverse-paddle-dab, gets a bottom edge fine for two
attempts to sweep, bit of bounce and it deflects off the shoulder, I think
sweeps, gets a top edge but it lands fine of the man on the edge of the ring and runs for a couple more
worked off the legs
pushed through flat outside off, dabbed behind square for another single

darted on the stumps, Faf mows towards wide long-on... towards the safe hands of Stokes, who makes no mistake! The captain picks out a fielder on the boundary this time and the pressure ratchets up another notch
back of a length, slightly wide but Rossouw drills his cut straight to deep point
short and rising sharply to the new man Miller, he jumps and rides the bounce, drops one square
banged in at 140kph, pulled behind square, came off the bottom edge and they think about running for two but Rossouw slipped and forced a quick rethink
knocked off his feet, right in front... but pitching outside leg! Jordan appeals but he'll have to settle for a dot ball
dug in, sits up nicely but Miller rifles a pull to deep midwicket
full outside off, larruped in front of extra cover but Rashid and Roy combine with a couple of smart dives to keep them to just a single
flighted on the stumps, Rossouw sweeps - and loops a top edge to short fine leg! Simple catch and England have another wicket at a key moment!
pushed through no the stumps, tries to reverse sweep and hit on the pad, not given
switches the hands and misses again, this time hit outside the line of off
that'll help the home nerves, gets underneath a fierce blow down the ground, just enough to clear the diving Roy on the long-off boundary
four more, lasered through the covers! Miller picks up back-to-back boundaries with a couple of brutal blows
swung through backward square leg, not a great connection but he'll keep the strike
pitched up and drilled down the ground, straight to long-on once more! Jordan has another, SA slip-slide again, this game is not giving up... Miller's candle is snuffed out and the pendulum swings
swings a top edge down to third man... is that a drop? No, Topley didn't quite get there running in, maybe could have done a bit better but couldn't get his hands under it
fired in full, excellent yorker from Jordan but they steal one anyway
short ball, Wiese swivels on the pull and gets it wide of deep square leg, they hurtle back for two
dragged on! Full and wide as Wiese stepped to leg, swung blindly and chopped the ball into leg stump!
short outside off, pulled down the ground, bounces to long-on - England happy to concede the single and keep Morris off strike
charges in over the wicket, 129kph and full on the stumps, dug out straight to mid-off but they run anyway
low full toss, Morris steps out and clubs four over cover! Met it with a meaty blow and there's no one out there
full toss on the stumps - and Morris slugs it into the stands at wide long-on! Huge from Morris, he's channeling his Wanderers mojo from last Friday! Just enough to clear the boundary rope
good length this time and Morris swings hard, mistimes it back to the bowler
full and straight, Morris gets under it and chips down the ground... long-off will cut it off but they get back for two

full and wide and slapped down the ground to long-off, they are going to come charging back for two... and Topley fails to gather as the throw comes in! It would have been a run-out and a tie but instead South Africa win by three wickets! Lummy
